div.span: hey hey i have one more question: if you know the pattern of a string but need the values in between the patterned stuff, where do you look?
for instance, this is the pattern:
i need to get the message the path and the value. however, i can get back this:
Validator {{message}} failed for path {{path}} with value {{value}}" and it can be like a million chained errors, all with the same pattern
it's a silly question, probably some clever regexing is in order
i just got berated by g again
and i think i must have looked off, cause he started apologizing

message.div: "Validator {{message}} failed for path \\neh\enhen ..ienhyn with value {{value}}".match(/^Validator ([\s\S]+) failed for path ([\s\S]+) with value ([\s\S]+)$/)
run that across an array of errors and you should get what you need

div.span: so i just had a standoff with g in the meeting
and i sort of lost this one
and then made a document for it to show exactly how everything is supposed to look and work
along with css styles and everythign
i mean there are specs of what it'll look like in each size, etc
and instead of implementing it himself he wanted to hand it off for me to do
but i was like.... uh.... why don't you just do it yourself
you took the time to measure everything out
and write down all the styles
what's display: none what's not, etc
i mean detailed stuff, i'm telling you
what's the use of handing it off to me?
and he kept calling it an experiment
like, he wants to see if handing this off and calling this finished on his end will work
but i felt like it was pretty condescending
he can do css, that's the one thing he can do
so i kinda felt like the "experiment" part of all of it was whether or not i can follow directions
i guess css is part of my job description officially now
he just gets to do design and live in a perfect world
where everything he makes is beautiful and perfect and doesn't actuallly exist in the real world where things have different sizes and are sized different

message.div: cause if it's not then just work on it

div.span: that little thing in itself of course not
but it seems like this is the direction it's going
and for that, it is very important
cause i guess now not only will i be in charge of making things actually work
so that's fun to think about

message.div: if that's what's gunna happen — i showed you pixel perfect, no?

div.span: it's more than that though, this isn't a website
it needs to show correctly on every screen
unfortunately pixel perfect can only get you so far
if it ends up being that i'm doing all of this work and not anything else then i'll bring it up again
meanwhile i'll just shut my mouth
it was nice to bring up my disease in the meeting though
i'm glad josh got to see it
might be interesting to read, not sure
